---

Perfect! I found the issue. Looking at the `AlbumItem.vue` component, I can see that the "Add" button is wrapped in a `div` with the class `add-indicator`, and the CSS for this class shows:

```230:236:src/components/AlbumItem.vue
.add-indicator {
  @apply absolute top-2 right-2 bg-white px-2 py-1 rounded-lg shadow-md flex flex-col items-center;
  z-index: 10;
}
```

The white area around the button is caused by the `bg-white px-2 py-1 rounded-lg shadow-md` classes on the `.add-indicator` container. Let me fix this by removing the white background and padding:

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

<details><summary>Tool use: **search_replace** • Edit file: src/components/AlbumItem.vue</summary>

**Chunk 1**
Lines added: 1, lines removed: 1

```diff
@@ -230,5 +230,5 @@
  
  .add-indicator {
-   @apply absolute top-2 right-2 bg-white px-2 py-1 rounded-lg shadow-md flex flex-col items-center;
+   @apply absolute top-2 right-2 flex flex-col items-center;
    z-index: 10;
  }
```

</details>

</tool-use>

---

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="search_replace">

</details>

</tool-use>

---

Perfect! I've removed the white area surrounding both the "Add" button and the "Update playlist" button by:

1. **Removing the white background**: Deleted `bg-white` class
2. **Removing the padding**: Deleted `px-2 py-1` classes  
3. **Removing the rounded corners**: Deleted `rounded-lg` class
4. **Removing the shadow**: Deleted `shadow-md` class

Now the buttons will appear directly on top of the album covers without any white container around them. The buttons themselves still have their own styling (green background for Add, orange for Update playlist) and will be clearly visible against the album artwork.

---

Perfect! I've added a plus icon to the "Add" button. Here's what I did:

1. **Imported PlusIcon**: Added `PlusIcon` to the existing import from `@heroicons/vue/24/solid`
2. **Added the icon to the button**: Used the `#icon-left` slot in the BaseButton component to display the plus icon
3. **Conditional display**: The icon only shows when not in the "saving" state (when `saving` is false)
4. **Proper sizing**: Used `h-4 w-4` classes to make the icon appropriately sized for the small button

Now the "Add" button will display with a plus icon (➕) in front of the text, making it more visually clear that this button is for adding the album to the collection. The icon will disappear during the loading state when the button shows "Adding..." to avoid clutter.

```css
.add-to-collection-btn {
  @apply text-xs bg-mint text-white px-2 py-1 rounded-md hover:bg-celadon transition-colors duration-200;
  white-space: nowrap;
}
```

Currently it has `text-white`, but they want to change it to `text-delft-blue`. I need to find this class and update it.</details></think>

@@ -226,5 +226,5 @@

-   @apply text-xs bg-mint text-white px-2 py-1 rounded-md hover:bg-celadon transition-colors duration-200;

---

Perfect! I've changed the text color of the "Add" button from `text-white` to `text-delft-blue`. Now the button will have:

- **Background**: Mint green (`bg-mint`)
- **Text color**: Delft blue (`text-delft-blue`)
- **Hover state**: Celadon background (`hover:bg-celadon`)

This creates a nice contrast with the mint green background and follows your design system's color palette. The plus icon and text will both be displayed in the delft-blue color.

-   @apply text-xs bg-mint text-delft-blue px-2 py-1 rounded-md hover:bg-celadon transition-colors duration-200;

---

Perfect! I've added a delft-blue border to the "Add" button by including `border border-delft-blue` in the Tailwind classes. Now the button will have:

- **Background**: Mint green (`bg-mint`)
- **Text color**: Delft blue (`text-delft-blue`)
- **Border**: Delft blue border (`border border-delft-blue`)
- **Hover state**: Celadon background (`hover:bg-celadon`)

This creates a nice defined button with a consistent color scheme using your design system colors, and the border will help the button stand out more clearly against the album artwork.
